messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: People have been painting and writing on walls for a very long time. In prehistoric times, for example, people in Africa and Europe painted pictures of animals and people in caves. Graffiti, which is writing or drawing on walls in public places, has been found on buildings at very old sites in Greece, Italy, Syria and Iraq. In the Roman town of Pompeii, archaeologists have found many examples of this writing in Latin, and these messages included religious, political and romantic ideas, as well as some magic spells.

metadata.feedback_text: This is an excellent simplification that successfully meets all B1 requirements. The output passed all priority checks, maintaining factual integrity and high scores for meaning (MeaningBERT 0.79) and fidelity (BERTScore 0.96). The CEFR classification is correct at B1. The strategy for defining the keyword 'graffiti' in-text using a relative clause ('which is writing or drawing...') is a perfect example of a B1-level technique. Vocabulary simplification was also handled well, for instance, changing 'ancient sites' to 'very old sites' and 'numerous' to 'many'. The text flows logically and is easy for a B1 learner to follow. A very strong submission.
